name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Armonk

reviews.text: I recently stayed one night at the La Quinta Armonk on business. While the room was clean and the bed comfortable, there were a number of issues that made my stay less than I would have liked.
reviews.title: Functional

reviews.text: Parking is very difficult, since the hotel allows people to park there and take the shuttle to the airport. Be prepared to drive around before you find a spot. Quite a few guests actually had to park illegally, although the driveway is big enough to allow this.
reviews.title: A little dated, but secure and out of the way.

reviews.text: The walls are extremely thin. You can hear everything from all of the rooms around you. There were at least two groups of people up very late near my room, but I was finally able to fall asleep after taking a Tylenol PM.
reviews.title: Two Words: Airport Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I had a nonsmoking room, the smell of smoke permeated my room during the night, obviously coming from someone else's room. Smoking rooms should be segregated to one section this hotel, as the property is quite large.
reviews.title: Excellent for dogs

reviews.text: The breakfast was plentiful and the food fine, but the counters in the breakfast area should have been wiped down more frequently.
reviews.title: Clean enough, large rooms, but outdated and no answer at front desk at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ended up staying here the night of March 18, 2009. Flight got cancelled by US Air at the last minute at 7:30 p.m. at Westchester County Airport. They suggested La Quinta (which has a free shuttle, and will come if you call them). The hotel is about 5 minutes from the airport. The hotel was just fine. Great water pressure in the shower, a quite large room with two double beds, good tv reception and channel choices. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel. Marc Charles, I think. They do have room service (or I should say, they will deliver to your room. You cannot charge it to your hotel bill. You must either pay cash when delivered or give them your credit card number to bill. I must say the restaurant is rather pricey. Much more than what you would expect attached to a La Quinta. I think my cheeseburger was $13 approx. After thinking about it, then I realized why. This, I believe, is basically a "business" hotel for traveling business people and is set in a corporate park environment so hence the higher prices at the restaurant. I'm sure most meals there are invoiced off by business people. I must say the burger was very good though. Nice, thick, juicy and cooked perfectly. Since I was only there for one night, hard to comment on more, but what I saw and experienced was just fine. Comfy bed, good a.c./heating, etc. When checking in I also told them I needed a ride back to the airport the following morning and I took the 8 a.m. shuttle which got there right away. Tipped the driver a couple of bucks. All in all, a good experience. Would recommend. Oh! One heads up! Upon trying to check into the room the first time with the card key, the door would not open even though the green light flashed. Went back to the front desk (which was a walk from our room). Clerk said insert the card and lift the handle UP. Voila! Who knew?! Never heard of that one before.
reviews.title: It was just fine.

reviews.text: This hotel was a nice place. Located in a business park and seemed like a very safe area. Good sized rooms, comfortable beds, restaurant with a lounge connected to the hotel, continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel/Motel

likes.liked: — Rooms were nice and beds were comfortable
likes.disliked: — Armonk appears to be in the middle of nowhere

reviews.text: Potential Downsides: Location is a bit out of the way, no other restaurants/stores/sign of life in the area. As a few others have mentioned, layout of the hotel is a bit spread out. Restaurant is a bit upscale/expensive, although lounge was more down to earth.
reviews.title: It was fine.

likes.liked: — It's value. A reasonable place for a modest price.

reviews.text: Didn't have a chance to eat breakfast so can't speak to that.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel for such an upscale area !

reviews.text: I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Overall, it was definitely a positive experience.
reviews.title: A Nightmare of Mismanagement

reviews.text: The hotel staff was friendly, welcoming and immediately accommodated any requests. The airport shuttle was extremely timely upon request both ways. My room was simple, quiet and comfortable. The draperies held the light out very nicely so that I was able to sleep in until 9:00am (my flight was not until 3:30pm and the staff readily granted me a late check-out).
reviews.title: A- Clean, A+ Staff, Some Technical Difficulties

likes.liked: — The hotel staff was friendly and welcoming.
likes.disliked: — No room service or restaurant onsite.

reviews.text: I got up and I went to draw the draperies to a beautiful sunlit morning and felt a bit exposed and disturbed when the entire drapery rod and draperies fell upon me. No worries. I quickly got over the shock and I went to take a shower.
reviews.title: Many problems still exist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathtub blinded me, even more than my now drapery-lacking window, with its sparkling cleanliness. I was looking forward to a relaxing shower. I had great difficulty with the bath fixtures. Bracing myself between the tub and commode, I wrestled with the fixture for a time, careful that the fixture wouldn't fall off too, and was finally able to succeed in turning on the water. The water temperature fluctuated mercilessly from freezing to scalding. The bathtub stop would not stay open. I also had to wrestle to turn the water off. So much for my relaxing shower.
reviews.title: Better than expected

likes.liked: — convenient to Purchase (State University of NY located there)

reviews.text: I went to get dressed an I could not get the closet door to open on the side where my clothes were hung. I wasn't going to chance a mirrored door falling on me so I just used the other side to get to my clothes. By this time, I was finding Room 222 pretty comical. What are the odds of all of this happening in one room, right?
reviews.title: dont be fooled by the new paint job

reviews.text: When told of my adventure, the front desk representative immediately asked if I was okay and seemed sincerely apologetic.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attended a wedding in Armonk and stayed at the La Quinta as that is where the bride and groom booked rooms. After reading some of the other reviews I was a little nervous. We discovered the hotel was pet friendly and decided to bring along our golden retriever rather than board him. Our room looked nice but definilty smelled as if other dogs had stayed there before. Even though the doors were locked, they didn't line up with the frame so it looked like it wasn't closed all the way. The hotel didn't look like much from the outside and it could use some updating on the inside but all in all it was a good stay.
reviews.title: Great for the Dog

reviews.text: If you are traveling with your pet, this hotel is ideal. Each corridor has a side entrance so I was able to take the dog in and out without having to parade him through the lobby and disturb other guests. The hotel is also situated on a nicely landscaped business park with lots of grassy areas and a quiet road to walk on.
reviews.title: Airport parking option is what it is about
This La Quinta is the "evil twin": Go To Elmsford Instead!"
reviews.text: It wasn't luxurious but it was clean, quiet, and inexpensive.

reviews.title: Great park and Fly deal for Westchester Airport
reviews.text: Plane Jane hotel with steakhouse connected to it. We did not try the steakhouse because of the looks of the building. True believer of judging a restaurant based on appearance of the building. Older hotel with low revenue so do not expect much in return. Was not the worst or best hotel we have stayed in, but it was pretty clean and we felt safe leaving the car there for a few days. Best part = 10 days of parking and one night stay for $100. Do not bother with parking at WestChester Airport (HPN) because of the price and availability. The free shuttle from the hotel was ontime both ways and the driver was a good guy. Try the center of Armonk for food and ice cream really good stuff there but a little on the pricy side. If you are on business and plan on staying in hotel for any length of time I would consider staying somewhere else. If you are a one nighter on a budget then I say go for it !!
I was on a 10 day business trip in the Chappaqua area and decided to sample two La Quinta motels, one in Elmsford, one in Armonk. The one is Armonk is the Evil Twin, the other the Good Twin.
reviews.title: Loved the Soothing Music

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Armonk
